segment.source: How to Apply the Deployment Configuration File by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Apply the Deployment Configuration File by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Apply the Deployment Configuration File by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Apply the Deployment Configuration File by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Apply the Deployment Configuration File by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Apply the Deployment Configuration File by Using PowerShell

segment.source: The dynamic deployment configuration file is applied when a package is added or set to a computer running the App-V 5.0 client before the package has been published.
segment.target: The dynamic deployment configuration file is applied when a package is added or set to a computer running the App-V 5.0 client before the package has been published.

segment.source: The file configures the default settings for package for all users on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: The file configures the default settings for package for all users on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: This section describes the steps used to use a deployment configuration file.
segment.target: This section describes the steps used to use a deployment configuration file.

segment.source: The procedure is based on the following example and assumes the following package and configuration files exist on a computer:
segment.target: The procedure is based on the following example and assumes the following package and configuration files exist on a computer:

segment.source: c:PackagesContosoMyApp.appv
segment.target: c:PackagesContosoMyApp.appv

segment.source: c:PackagesContosoDynamicConfigurationsdeploymentconfig.xml
segment.target: c:PackagesContosoDynamicConfigurationsdeploymentconfig.xml

segment.source: To Apply the Deployment Configuration File Using PowerShell
segment.target: To Apply the Deployment Configuration File Using PowerShell

segment.source: To specify a new default set of configurations for all users who will run the package on a specific computer, using a PowerShell console type the following:
segment.target: To specify a new default set of configurations for all users who will run the package on a specific computer, using a PowerShell console type the following:

segment.source: Add-AppVClientPackage –Path c:PackagesContosoMyApp.appv -DynamicDeploymentConfiguration c:PackagesContosoDynamicConfigurationsdeploymentconfig.xml
segment.target: Add-AppVClientPackage –Path c:PackagesContosoMyApp.appv -DynamicDeploymentConfiguration c:PackagesContosoDynamicConfigurationsdeploymentconfig.xml

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This command captures the resulting object into $pkg.
segment.target: This command captures the resulting object into $pkg.

segment.source: If the package is already present on the computer, the Set-AppVclientPackage cmdlet can be used to apply the deployment configuration document:
segment.target: If the package is already present on the computer, the Set-AppVclientPackage cmdlet can be used to apply the deployment configuration document:

segment.source: Set-AppVClientPackage –Name Myapp –Path c:PackagesContosoMyApp.appv -DynamicDeploymentConfiguration c:PackagesContosoDynamicConfigurationsdeploymentconfig.xml
segment.target: Set-AppVClientPackage –Name Myapp –Path c:PackagesContosoMyApp.appv -DynamicDeploymentConfiguration c:PackagesContosoDynamicConfigurationsdeploymentconfig.xml
